file_content.text: So we've got a Sith governor. That's a change for the better.
Governor's waiting on you. Take too long, the Sith will be, too.
Hold up! You're the group that cut a path from Sobrik, right?
My lord--you're Darth Baras's apprentice, right?
Due respect, I understand you're Lord Zash's apprentice.
Sir! Sergeant Thadus, here for Cipher Nine.
Hunter! You're that mercenary all the troops have been talking about.
Got orders from the planetary governor to find you. You're needed at his war conference, priority alpha one.
Why does the Balmorran governor need me?
Tell me what's going on.
I don't remember telling the Balmorran governor about my business.
You're awfully well informed.
Empire appoints you to run this planet, you keep track of who's slaughtering the resistance.
If the governor wants me, let him beg at the feet of my master. I have other concerns.
I don't serve the governor.
Many here could benefit from my wisdom. But I must see to my own goals.
He can get in line.
This is Sith business as well. Promise.
I'm not here to handle local concerns. My priorities supersede yours.
I'm not on your payroll.
Not looking for an argument; just passing the word.
A war conference is still a conference. Maybe you don't know who I am.
I don't do consulting.
Just what the HoloNet gossip says, but you'll be paid for your time.
The Dark Council sent an emissary--big time Sith Lord--to personally review the status of the Balmorran occupation.
This conference will determine the next stage of the ground campaign. Whole war's about to be decided, and the governor wants your expertise.
I'll join your war council. Make sure they're expecting me.
Tell the governor I'm coming.
This emissary of the Dark Council--what do we know about him?
You mentioned a Sith Lord....
Sith politics aren't my business. One of Darth Marr's servants, is what I hear--don't know anything else.
The governor fears the Dark Council's wrath. He hopes I can shield him.
The man is desperate.
If you say so, my lord.
Let me guess: The governor needs support from Imperial Intelligence.
He wants Intelligence allies.
That's really none of my business, sir.
If the only person he can trust is a bounty hunter, your governor's got trouble.
Guess you're all incompetent.
Maybe, but he's a survivor.
Assigning black-level clearance--no one will cause you trouble. Be quick, though... they're starting any minute.
Stay alert. The Balmorran Arms Factory isn't far, and the Republic's set up there.
